item.title: AirlineSim | The online airline simulation and management game
item.description:
AirlineSim | The online airline simulation and management game

The only Airline Simulation of its kind: With over 300 different aircraft, nearly 4000 destinations worldwide, and a realistic economic model, AirlineSim offers you the opportunity to manage the airline of your dreams. Are you willing to take a shot at building an aviation empire?

item.title: Happy Anniversary To The Dermis!
item.description:
Happy Anniversary To The Dermis!

I can't believe it has been just over one year since I started The Dermis! This experience has been very rewarding, as well as challenging for me. Finding time to research and write posts while still working with clients and running my shop has been a test! But then I went back and read my introductory post about why I decided to start The Dermis, all of it still rings true.One small change I'll be making in the coming year is linking to some of my recommendations when applicable. While I've really tried to deliver non-brand specific information, the feedback I've received from clients has been to include more info on what I personally like and carry when appropriate.  I'll be doing this in the least disruptive way possible, discreet links for those of you who want to be taken to my shop, or to a specific product description. I've also looked at which types of posts seem to resonate the most with you, and will gear upcoming content in that direction.Finally, thanks to everyone who asked questions, gave feedback, and yes, found my typos. (I have no doubt I will be generous with many more in the year to come.)  Onward!

item.title: Core Principles of Growth Hackers
item.description:
Core Principles of Growth Hackers

I asked three growth hackers -   Morgan Brown, Lincoln Murphy, and Jim Gray  - "What five tools are in your growth hackers' toolbox?" I loved that their initial responses weren't products (which is unexpected, right?):

item.title: Wayne Thom's photographs will help you see Brutalism in a new light
item.description:
Wayne Thom's photographs will help you see Brutalism in a new light

Like it or not, Brutalism is back. The late Modern style notable for its muscular massing, structural gymnastics, and rough slabs of raw concrete is experiencing something of a renaissance on multiple fronts: A new BBC show, The Game, based in 1970s London, glamorizes the Brutalist aesthetic the way Mad Men did midcentury Modernism.

item.title: 8 Ways to Increase Your Brand Awareness in 2015 - Eventbrite Blog
item.description:
8 Ways to Increase Your Brand Awareness in 2015 - Eventbrite Blog

Last year we bid farewell to recession ('hurrah!') - and not a moment too soon - but growing a business remains tough for everyone. Besides traditional advertising, what can you do to help put your brand name on everybody's lips in 2015? We've compiled eight ideas to get people talking...

item.title: Crafting cultural icons: designing hardware in the digital age | The Startup Magazine
item.description:
Crafting cultural icons: designing hardware in the digital age | The Startup Magazine

The design process is organic. The white moments arrive after a gestation period for both us and the client. We have a fair amount of dialogue, breaking up the core issues and core problems we are facing. When that idea arrives, there is always a recognition that this is an important concept, a big recognition.
